SELECT T1.ROLE_ID AS roleId, T1.ROLE_NAME AS roleName, T1.ROLE_DESC AS roleDesc, T2.USER_NAME AS addUser, T1.ADD_TIME AS addTime, T3.USER_NAME AS updateUser, T1.UPDATE_TIME AS updateTime FROM sys_role T1 LEFT JOIN sys_user T2 ON T2.USER_ID = T1.ADD_USER_ID LEFT JOIN sys_user T3 ON T3.USER_ID = T1.UPDATE_USER_ID WHERE 1=1
AND T1.ROLE_NAME like '%${roleName}%'
AND T1.ROLE_DESC like '%${roleDesc}%'
ORDER BY T1.ROLE_ID
mapper.insert: INSERT INTO sys_role ( ROLE_NAME, ROLE_DESC, ADD_USER_ID, ADD_TIME, UPDATE_USER_ID, UPDATE_TIME, VERSION ) VALUES( #{roleName}, #{roleDesc}, #{sys_user}, NOW(), #{sys_user}, NOW(), 0 )
mapper.select:
SELECT T1.ROLE_ID AS roleId, T1.ROLE_NAME AS roleName, T1.ROLE_DESC AS roleDesc, T1.ADD_USER_ID AS addUser, T1.ADD_TIME AS addTime, T1.UPDATE_USER_ID AS updateUser, T1.UPDATE_TIME AS updateTime FROM sys_role T1 WHERE T1.ROLE_NAME = #{roleName}
AND T1.ROLE_ID != #{roleId}

mapper.update: UPDATE sys_role SET ROLE_NAME = #{roleName}, ROLE_DESC = #{roleDesc}, UPDATE_USER_ID = #{sys_user}, UPDATE_TIME = NOW(), VERSION = VERSION + 1 WHERE ROLE_ID=#{roleId}
